newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-FOUR-MATCH BAN FOR CAGLIARI DEFENDER FOR SPITTING.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FOUR-MATCH BAN FOR CAGLIARI DEFENDER FOR SPITTING.

text.p: Cagliari defender Giuseppe Pancaro, sent off for spitting in the face of Inter goalkeeper Gianluca Pagliuca last week, was given a four-match suspension from Italian Cup matches on Tuesday.

Pancaro, who has since apologised for the incident in Cagliari, was shown the red card after scoring an 85th minute penalty for the Sardinian team in their 2-2 third round draw and then clashing with Pagliuca in the goalmouth.
Italy's serie A sporting judge also fined Reggiana 40 million lire ($24,000) after their fans threw various objects on the pitch, including a coin that hit the referee.
